en.home_subtitle: Instantly compress, convert, and crop your images for your website. Free and secure.
en.home_mission_title: A Small Footprint, One Pixel at a Time.
en.home_mission_text: Every image you optimize doesn't just save space, it saves energy. Less data transfer and storage mean a smaller digital footprint for a healthier planet. Join us in making the web faster and greener.
en.home_howitworks_step3_text: Our server compresses your images while preserving quality. The compression ratio is shown as a percentage.
en.home_howitworks_step6_text: Our server deletes automatically all uploaded pictures within 24 hours.
en.home_announcement: Welcome.  Herzlich Willkommen.  HoÅŸ geldiniz.  æ¬¢è¿.
en.contact_intro: If you have any questions, feedback, or suggestions, we'd love to hear from you. The best way to reach us is by email.
en.contact_outro: We'll do our best to get back to you as soon as possible.
en.about_mission: Our mission is to provide a fast, free, and easy-to-use tool for everyone to optimize their images for the web. We believe in a faster, more efficient, and greener internet.
en.about_why_text: Every image you optimize doesn't just improve your website's loading speed; it also reduces the energy required for data transfer and storage. This means a smaller digital footprint and a small but meaningful contribution to a more sustainable planet.
en.about_tech_text: Image Guy is powered by the high-performance `sharp` library, running on a scalable serverless architecture. This allows us to offer top-tier optimization for various formats like JPEG, PNG, WebP, and AVIF without compromising on quality.
en.blog_subtitle: Tips, tricks, and insights on image optimization and web performance.
en.blog_post1_title: How Does Image Optimization Save Our Planet?
en.blog_post1_excerpt: Learn why optimizing images is critical for site speed, sustainability, and SEO, with practical tips for better web performance.
en.terms_section1_text: By accessing and using Image Guy ("the Service"), you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement.
en.terms_section2_text: Image Guy is a free-to-use web tool that allows users to optimize and compress image files. The Service is provided on an "as-is" and "as-available" basis without any warranties.
en.terms_section3_text: You are solely responsible for the content (images) you upload. You must ensure you have the necessary rights and permissions for any content you process with the Service. You agree not to upload any content that is illegal, harmful, or otherwise objectionable.
en.terms_section4_text: We claim no ownership rights over the images you upload. The intellectual property of your content remains entirely yours. The design, logo, and "Image Guy" brand are the property of this website.
en.terms_section5_text: We are not liable for any loss of data or quality degradation that may occur. We reserve the right to block any user from the Service for misuse or abuse.
en.privacy_section1_text: Images you upload are sent to our secure cloud servers (Amazon S3 and Netlify Functions) for the sole purpose of optimization. Original and optimized images may be stored temporarily to ensure service delivery and are automatically deleted. We do not access, share, or use your images for any other purpose.
en.privacy_section2_text: We do not collect any personal information. You are not required to create an account or provide any personal data to use Image Guy. We may use privacy-friendly analytics to monitor website traffic, but this data is anonymized and does not track individual users.
en.privacy_section3_text: Our service is built upon professional cloud infrastructure provided by Netlify and Amazon Web Services (AWS). These services have their own robust privacy and security policies.
en.favicon_post_meta_title: First of all, what is a favicon?
en.favicon_post_title: How to Create a Cute Favicon in Few Simple Steps
en.favicon_post_excerpt: Learn how to create an optimized favicon in few simple steps, perfect for your website.
en.favicon_post_p1: A favicon is a small â€œsweetâ€ icon that represents your website. It was used for the first time in 1999, initially in Internet Explorer's bookmark section. Following its standardization in the next decade, it's displayed as of today in browser tabs, bookmark lists, and next to your site's name in search engine results. While contributing to recognition of your brand in great amount, this tiny logo helps users quickly identify your website among many open tabs.
en.favicon_post_p2: While favicons can come in various formats, the most common are .png (1996) and .ico (1985). The .ico format is highly compatible and can contain multiple sizes in a single file, while a .png favicon is a modern, high-quality alternative.
en.favicon_post_p3: In this brief article, I'll show you how to create a perfect favicon in just a few simple steps using Image Guy.
en.favicon_post_step1_text: Start by uploading your logo or any image you want to convert. The server accepts common formats like JPG, PNG, WebP, AVIF, and HEIC.
en.favicon_post_step2_title: 2. Choose Your Favicon Format and Click "Optimize All"
en.favicon_post_step2_text: Select either "Favicon (PNG)" or "Favicon (ICO)" from the output options. Click the "Optimize" button. The process usually takes less than 10 seconds.
en.favicon_post_toggle_png_text: This will create a standard 32x32 pixel PNG icon, perfect for modern browsers.
en.favicon_post_toggle_ico_text: This option generates a more traditional .ico file that contains multiple resolutions (16x16, 24x24, 32x32, 48x48, and 64x64 pixels) to ensure your icon looks sharp on all platforms.
en.favicon_post_step3_text: After optimization is finished, you can also use the "Edit & Crop" tool for any final adjustments before downloading. For example, you can crop your image into a circle. When your image is ready, click on "Download".
en.favicon_post_step4_title: 4. Add the Favicon to Your Website
en.favicon_post_step4_text: Once downloaded, place the favicon in your website's root directoryâ€”root directories are the first places scanned by search enginesâ€”and add one of the following code snippets to the <head> section of your HTML. Remember to adjust the "href" path if needed.
en.favicon_post_outro: Footnote: All these images used in this article are optimized up to 76% and converted to webp format. Enjoy creating your new favicons! Thank you for reading.
